title: Procurement overview
line1: Follow the steps below to create your procurement. Each stage can be saved and resumed at any time.
line2: You can download and save what you enter to your own system.
line4: Check the terms and conditions for this lot in the lot detail page.

sections: Every supplier is checked to make sure they can supply the products or services offered by the commercial agreement.

You can ask suppliers questions, before formally publishing your requirements, to find out what products and services are available, or to refine your needs. For the lot you selected, you can do pre-market engagement in the following way:
subsections: Gather information for your project from suppliers about the products and services they offer, and the commercial terms needed to buy them.
This section is optional, if you’re ready to write and publish your requirements you can go straight to the next step.
You cannot run steps 2 and 3 at the same time.

sections: Write and publish your bid pack for suppliers, who can then submit their responses to your requirements and complete any other evaluation tasks set by you.
You’ll need a clear set of criteria that suppliers will need to meet and be evaluated against. You will also need to include how you will score their responses.
For the lot you selected, you can run your procurement in the following way:
subsections: You’ll need to invite all suppliers to bid for your opportunity and assess all bids that are submitted.
This is also known as one-stage further competition.

sections: You must evaluate suppliers to find the one that best meets your requirements.
You should use the methods and criteria you published with your requirements to assess and score suppliers.
You can then award a contract to the successful supplier.
When you have completed your evaluation and found a successful supplier, you can award your contract.
You’ll need to give feedback to any unsuccessful suppliers.
There is a legal requirement to publish certain contracts. You may need to publish the contract on:

content.text: Digital Specialists and Programmes, Lot 2: Specialists
